messages.text:
On Wed, Feb 6, 2013 at 9:15 AM, Dave Cheney <dave@cheney.net> wrote:

> Tests pass on my builder but I don't feel qualified to assert more than
> that.

Thank you very much for verifying that the all.bash passed.
I just bought an ODROID-U2 so soon i will have a fast Linux/ARM machine
for testing again.

Please note that FreeBSD/ARM build will also be broken by the same CL
that breaks Linux/ARM build, and that's expected.
Its fix is in https://codereview.appspot.com/7311047/, but I haven't tested
it yet.

Hello dave@cheney.net, rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

Understood, when I start winning the war of keeping builders online,
I'll be sure to test that.

On Wed, Feb 6, 2013 at 11:44 AM, minux <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:
> Please note that FreeBSD/ARM build will also be broken by the same CL
> that breaks Linux/ARM build, and that's expected.
> Its fix is in https://codereview.appspot.com/7311047/, but I haven't tested
> it yet.

Tests pass on my builder but I don't feel qualified to assert more than that.

On Wed, Feb 6, 2013 at 11:41 AM,  <dave@cheney.net> wrote:
> Thanks, testing now.
>
> https://codereview.appspot.com/7299055/

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=c224c490576b ***

runtime: fix build for Linux/ARM

R=dave, rsc
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/7299055

subject: code review 7299055: runtime: fix build for Linux/ARM
